intro: Zaluzianskya trichopoda, commonly known as the silverleaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-green leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and long-lasting blooms.
